title: DirectX Error Need to update driver
body: I have been having a problem of not being able to get into league games, and getting the error of [](https://images.scdn8.secure.raxcdn.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/11/error-an-unknown-directx-error-has-occurred-and-lol-cannot-start.jpg)    and i have tried all solutions of deleting the config folder and restarting my display adapter, trying to fix from all the other solutions from other forums but nothing works..... HELP ME I HAVE ELO DECAY, and i need to play ANYTHING helps  PLZ!!  i did download OBS and started to live stream but that was the instant where it started, so is there a certain download in OBS now that messes with the new patch? i need answers....

replies.body: I have had the same problem for the last 5 patches and they say it is common with AMD cards. I have a 390x 8GB and I get it time and time again I do all the troubleshooting they suggest it works once and I log in the next day to get the same thing, Honestly isn't worth it anymore.

This problem has plagued me for months and I finally resolved it.  When I swap out my AMD R9 290 with a Nvidia GTX 660 the problem goes away.  been playing for weeks with the Nvidia card with not one error.  If I reinstall the AMD card, the error pops up 50% of the time.  Playing with the config folders and different versions of drivers were only  temporary fixes.  I'm not too happy about having to use the slower GTX 660, but it's the only way to play League at this time.  So until Riot and AMD work out this compatibility issue, AMD card owners are out of luck.

Hmmmm I'm not entirely sure why using OBS to stream would start this odd DirectX error, but most likely what's happening is some sort of faulty interaction between League, OBS, and your graphics/directX drivers. I'd suggest double checking for any missed [**DirectX drivers**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201761974#wq3) as well as updating your [**graphics drivers**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752684).
never mind i fixed it full initial repair of computer reset a portion of windows and it fixed it must be a recent windows update or something on windows 10
i checked all microsoft updates and everything else and im currently updating my AMD Radeon r7 250 series and that might be the issue, i wasnt getting any notification it needed updating

everything down loaded and it is still not working....
maybe a full refresh?
i have DirectX 12 version which version am i suppose to have?
